revised_title: CD4 Lymphocyte Glycoprotein in Health and Disease: Regulation of CD4-p56lck-Associated Phosphatidylinositol Kinases
tldr: This article investigates the role of CD4-p56lck complex in T cell activation and its association with phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (PI 3-kinase) and phosphatidylinositol 4-kinase (PI 4-kinase). The authors demonstrate that crosslinking of CD4 and HIV-1 gp120 increases the activity of both PI 3- and PI 4-kinases, suggesting a potential role in HIV-induced immune defects.
